title._content: Student at the Moses Montefiore Hebrew School in Duluth

tag.raw: Jewish Historical Society of the Upper Midwest
tag.author: 48143042@N05

description._content: The Hebrew School was formally organized in 1905 and incorporated in 1908. The driving force behind the school was Mrs. Ida Cook, a Lithuanian immigrant. The school, according to the articles of incorporation, was to "…furnish persons of Hebrew parentage with religious instruction in harmony with the Hebrew religion; to teach the Hebrew and English languages...and to promote religious principles and devotion." The school later became the Duluth Talmud Torah. Date: 1916 Source: 24 cm x 19.5 cm Format: Sepia original photo Subject: Education; Talmud Torah--Duluth; Religious education Coverage: Duluth; St. Louis; Minnesota; United States Local Identifier: 260 Link to our record: http://reflections.mndigital.org/u?/jhs,329 From the Steinfeldt Photography Collection of the Jewish Historical Society of the Upper Midwest.
